intro: Oenothera subovata, commonly known as the smooth evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers produce small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Oenothera subovata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
